info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 6:14PM CDT until October 24 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Crockett.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 613 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ozona, The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405, The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 290, The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163, Ft Lancaster and I-10 Near The Crockett- Pecos County Line. - This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 328 and 379.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... crossings along County Road 208, Live Oak crossing Live Oak Creek, Live Oak Road crossing Live Oak Creek, crossings along County Road 411 and crossings along County Road 401. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING
